post.description: Add a file or directory to IPFS.

parameters.name: quiet
parameters.description: Write minimal output.

parameters.name: quieter
parameters.description: Write only final hash.

parameters.name: silent
parameters.description: Write no output.

parameters.name: progress
parameters.description: Stream progress data.

parameters.name: trickle
parameters.description: Use trickle-dag format for dag generation.

parameters.name: only-hash
parameters.description: Only chunk and hash - do not write to disk.

parameters.name: wrap-with-directory
parameters.description: Wrap files with a directory object.

parameters.name: chunker
parameters.description: Chunking algorithm, size-[bytes], rabin-[min]-[avg]-[max] or buzhash.

parameters.name: pin
parameters.description: Pin this object when adding.

parameters.name: raw-leaves
parameters.description: Use raw blocks for leaf nodes.

parameters.name: nocopy
parameters.description: Add the file using filestore. Implies raw-leaves. (experimental).

parameters.name: fscache
parameters.description: Check the filestore for pre-existing blocks. (experimental).

parameters.name: cid-version
parameters.description: CID version. Defaults to 0 unless an option that depends on CIDv1 is passed. Passing version 1 will cause the raw-leaves option to default to true.

parameters.name: hash
parameters.description: Hash function to use. Implies CIDv1 if not sha2-256. (experimental).

parameters.name: inline
parameters.description: Inline small blocks into CIDs. (experimental).

parameters.name: inline-limit
parameters.description: Maximum block size to inline. (experimental).

requestBody.description:
Argument `path` is of file type. This endpoint expects one or several files (depending on the command) in the body of the request as 'multipart/form-data'.



The `add` command not only allows adding files, but also uploading directories and complex hierarchies.

This happens as follows: Every part in the multipart request is a *directory* or a *file* to be added to IPFS.

Directory parts have a special content type `application/x-directory`. These parts do not carry any data. The part headers look as follows:

```
Content-Disposition: form-data; name="file"; filename="folderName"
Content-Type: application/x-directory
```

File parts carry the file payload after the following headers:

```
Abspath: /absolute/path/to/file.txt
Content-Disposition: form-data; name="file"; filename="folderName%2Ffile.txt"
Content-Type: application/octet-stream

...contents...
```

The above file includes its path in the "folderName/file.txt" hierarchy and IPFS will therefore be able to add it inside "folderName". The parts declaring the directories are optional when they have files inside and will be inferred from the filenames. In any case, a depth-first traversal of the directory tree is recommended to order the different parts making the request.

The `Abspath` header is included for filestore/urlstore features that are enabled with the `nocopy` option and it can be set to the location of the file in the filesystem (within the IPFS root), or to its full web URL.

parameters.description:
Time duration that the record will be valid for.
This accepts durations such as "300s", "1.5h" or "2h45m". Valid time units are
"ns", "us" (or "µs"), "ms", "s", "m", "h".

parameters.name: allow-offline
parameters.description: When offline, save the IPNS record to the the local datastore without broadcasting to the network instead of simply failing.

parameters.description: Time duration this record should be cached for. Uses the same syntax as the lifetime option. (caution: experimental).

post.description: Print IPFS bandwidth information.

parameters.name: peer
parameters.description: Specify a peer to print bandwidth for.

parameters.name: proto
parameters.description: Specify a protocol to print bandwidth for.

parameters.name: poll
parameters.description: Print bandwidth at an interval.

parameters.name: interval
parameters.description:
Time interval to wait between updating output, if 'poll' is true.This accepts durations such as "300s", "1.5h" or "2h45m". Valid time units are:
"ns", "us" (or "µs"), "ms", "s", "m", "h".

post.description: Returns statistics about the node's DHT(s).

parameters.name: arg
parameters.description: The DHT whose table should be listed (wanserver, lanserver, wan, lan). wan and lan refer to client routing tables. When using the experimental DHT client only WAN is supported. Defaults to wan and lan.
